definition: stilts/walking on stilts as component of folk dance
to raise one's foot/to stand on tiptoe/stilts
(bird species of China) stilt sandpiper (Calidris himantopus)

sentences.english: The 100 over-water bungalows perch on stilts above the turquoise lagoon.
sentences.chinese: 在100個水平房鱸魚上方的綠松石瀉湖高蹺。

sentences.english: Walking on  stilts is another traditional performance event popular in china.
sentences.chinese: 還有一種至今仍受人歡迎的傳統表演活動，叫踩高蹺。

sentences.english: According to the archives, our Chinese ancestors began using stilts to help them gather fruits from trees.
sentences.chinese: 根據記載，我們的祖先踩高蹺是爲了從樹上摘果子。

sentences.english: In northeast China, the "Gaoqiao"in southern Liaoning is the most famous.
sentences.chinese: 東北盛行高蹺，並以“遼南高蹺”最負盛名。

sentences.english: In northeast China, the "Gaoqiao"in southern Liaoning is the most famous.
sentences.chinese: 東北盛行高蹺，並以“遼南高蹺”最負盛名。

sentences.english: Others were fitted with stilts in the form of pig-bristles glued to their feet.
sentences.chinese: 其它的螞蟻則在其腳部粘上豬鬃，做成高蹺。

sentences.english: And she followed him into the kitchen like a pony on high heels.
sentences.chinese: 她跟着他來到廚房，像匹踩着高蹺的小馬。

sentences.english: Sometimes you even see him parading down Main Street on stilts.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，你甚至可以看到他遊街下來高蹺大街。

sentences.english: Walking on stilts is another traditional performance event popular in china.
sentences.chinese: 還有一種至今仍受人歡迎的傳統表演活動，叫踩高蹺。

sentences.english: Stilt walking is one of the various shows in ancient China;
sentences.chinese: 高蹺本屬中國古代百戲之一種，早在春秋時已經出現。

sentences.english: Stilt dance basic moves are Yangko step.
sentences.chinese: 高蹺舞的基本動作是秧歌步。

sentences.english: How can they walk on stilts here?
Stilt-walking, drumming and dragon and lion dancing are the main entertainment forms of the Lantern Festival.
sentences.chinese: 踩高蹺，敲大鼓和舞龍獅也是元宵節主要的娛樂活動。

definition: to be adjusted to uniformity (usually of weights and measures) (idiom)
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose
Tonggu county in Yichun 宜春, Jiangxi
honor guard/guard of honor/the banner bearing contingent leading a military procession
